items.title: China launches live-fire drills around Taiwan in warning to 'separatist forces'
items.summary: Taipei condemned the "military intimidation", described by China's military as simulating a blockade of key ports.

items.title: How to turn your unwanted Christmas gifts into someone else's treasure
items.summary: If you've been handed a gift for Christmas that just doesn't tick the right boxes for you, it might just be the perfect item for someone else.

items.title: 'It's patronising': Ley criticises PM as he resists fresh calls for Bondi royal commission
items.summary: There have been growing calls for a federal inquiry into antisemitism, but Anthony Albanese has so far declined to pursue one.

items.title: E-mobility rules toughen — but young Australians remain vulnerable. Here's why
items.summary: As governments tighten rules on e-mobility devices, experts say policy gaps remain in keeping young people safe on the roads.

items.title: Got some spare cash in the bank? Here's what experts say you should do with it
items.summary: It's important to factor in your age, income and financial goals when making an investment plan.

items.title: Why exposing wrongdoing in Australia isn't as easy as blowing the whistle
items.summary: Proposed reforms would expand whistleblower protections, but advocates say they don't go far enough.

items.title: The latest weather forecasts for New Year's Eve and New Year's Day
items.summary: Here's the latest capital-city weather forecasts from the Bureau of Meteorology.

items.title: Trump and Zelenskyy say peace deal is close but 'thorny issues' remain
items.summary: The two leaders met at Trump's Mar-a-Lago resort in Florida for talks on ending the war in Ukraine.

items.title: Low voter turnout in first Myanmar elections since 2021 military coup
items.summary: The military junta said the election would bring political stability to Myanmar, despite rights groups saying the vote was neither free nor fair.

items.title: French film icon Brigitte Bardot dies aged 91
items.summary: Brigitte Bardot was propelled into international stardom when she played a teen bride in the 1956 movie And God Created Woman.

items.title: 'Envy of the developed world': Is our superannuation system working for all Australians?
items.summary: Australians collectively have more than $4 trillion in superannuation. However, some question whether the system is truly benefiting them.

items.title: Dani's mum's death came with a raft of complications. Here's what she wishes she'd known
items.summary: From inherited debt to superannuation, these are some of the things that can happen when someone dies.

items.title: Minns vows to keep 'racist' preacher's venue shut, flags new security plans
items.summary: The premier flagged the possibility of deploying the army to protect Jewish institutions and arming a Jewish community security organisation.

items.title: Cyclone Alfred among top ten costliest climate-change-linked disasters of 2025
items.summary: Economic losses caused by the fierce storm that ravaged southeast Queensland and northern NSW clocked in at roughly $1.8 billion.

items.title: Inside Australia's rental crunch — and what the numbers say about 2026
items.summary: As summer listings rise, a tight supply and strong demand keep affordability pressures high. Here's what's next for the rental market in 2026.

items.title: 'Guerrilla rewilding': The people controversially fighting to restore near-extinct animals
items.summary: Rewilders around the world have sought to reintroduce species to their traditional habitats. But not all efforts have official approval.

items.title: Trump and Zelenskyy will meet to discuss Ukraine's peace proposal. Here's what's on the agenda
items.summary: Ukrainian President Volodymyr Zelenskyy has met with Canadian Prime Minister Mark Carney and European leaders ahead of his crucial meeting with Donald Trump.

items.title: Myanmar goes to polls after five years of civil war. Here's how the junta-run vote will work
items.summary: The military has framed the votes as a return to democracy, but experts and rights groups say the military is "engineering an outcome".

items.title: From the White House to the Vatican: A year of global turning points
items.summary: Here's a look at 2025, shaped by global events — from political shifts to natural disasters — defining a year of change and challenge.

items.title: How changing our safety signs could save lives every summer
items.summary: Experts are warning that Australia's beach warning signs do not clearly convey the message to those who do not speak English as a first language.

items.title: How a hostel set up over 100 years ago is still helping to change women's lives
items.summary: A century-old women's hostel has evolved, but it's continued its mission of supporting housing for women.

items.title: 'Not achieving the best we can': Why language learning is dwindling in Australia
items.summary: Learning a language can help with employability, but that focus is putting one of Australia’s most popular languages — and its connection to culture — at risk.

items.title: Thailand and Cambodia announce 'immediate' ceasefire
items.summary: The ceasefire follows three days of border negotiations, announced after a crisis meeting of ASEAN foreign ministers.

items.title: 'We have to do more': Wong apologises to Jewish community over Bondi terror attack
items.summary: The foreign minister said she would visit Bondi at an appropriate time, also conceding more had to be done to combat antisemitism.
